Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Peddler \Ped"dler\, n. [OE. pedlere, pedlare, also peddare, peoddare, fr. OE. ped a basket, of unknown origin.] One who peddles; a traveling trader; one who travels about, retailing small wares; a hawker. [Written also {pedlar} and {pedler}.] ``Some vagabond huckster or peddler.'' --Hakluyt. [1913 Webster]

peddler n 1: someone who travels about selling his wares (as on the streets or at carnivals) [syn: {pedlar}, {packman}, {hawker}, {pitchman}] 2: an unlicensed dealer in illegal drugs [syn: {pusher}, {drug peddler}, {drug dealer}, {drug trafficker}]
